thread.title: Don't wear shorts or sneakers to Club Nomadic this weekend

author: Amber Elliott, Houston Chronicle
title: Don't wear shorts or sneakers to Club Nomadic this weekend

Patric Schneider, For The Chronicle Image 19 of 19 Don't wear shorts or sneakers to Club Nomadic this weekend 1 / 19 Back to Gallery 
One night down, two to go. 
For concert-goers heading to Club Nomadic this weekend to see Bruno Mars or Taylor Swift in action, beware, the temporary venue has a strict dress code policy. 
This isn't a music festival after all. 
Nomadic Entertainment's website clearly states: "fashionable upscale attire required." To clarify, this means that athletic apparel, t-shirts, tank tops, short, torn or cutoff clothing, men's sandals, sneakers, and athletic shoes are prohibited. 
Guess that means leave your concert tees and Converse All-Stars at home. 
Truth be told, Thursday night's crowd did appear rather stylish. For context, Chester Pitts wore a suit and rapper Ja Rule donned matching camouflage separates; "upscale" camo print, naturally. 
Most women opted for fitted dresses, nice tops with skinny jeans, and heels. A few, including yours truly, rocked motorcycle boots. 
Click through the slideshow to see how Houston dressed up for the week's biggest dance party - thus far, anyway.
